column2: The Accounts Receivable Associate will be responsible for timely and accurate processing of customer payments   Checks and verifies cost accounting, accounts receivable records, ensures invoices are paid, files, posts ledger and general ledger journal entries, and/or balances accounts receivable   Uses office automated systems to input data, generate reports, conduct specialized research projects and respond to inquiries   May reconcile difficult accounts   Additionally, this position will provide general support to the Finance Department as needed to support the overall organizational goals    Responsibilities        Post customer payments to accounts receivable ledger.     Escalate all accounts receivable issues to business management and appropriate operational manager.     To prepare monthly cash receipts forecast for assigned customer accounts.     Research customer receivable and payment issues.     Provide backup support to revenue billing staff as required.     Provide customer service regarding collection issues.     Proper center and expense coding within general ledger.     Research AR invoice and payment issues as required.     Interact and support general accounting staff as required.     Maintain cash application files of supporting documentation.     Enlist the efforts of sales and senior management when necessary to accelerate the collection process.     Must communicate and follow up effectively with sales managers regarding customer accounts on a timely basis.     Perform other assigned tasks and duties necessary to support the Revenue Team.       Qualifications        Bachelors degree required or equivalent experience.     2 - 4 years of progressively responsible experience in related roles.     Requires understanding of accounting concepts, practices and procedures.     Requires experience with computerized accounting systems.     Great Plains/SAP experience preferred.     Microsoft Word and Excel experience required.     Ability to work well both independently and to work collaboratively in teams.     Ability to effectively prioritize problems and manage multiple requests/expectations.     Recognized as a team member who is actively involved in attacking issues, while maintaining an excellent attitude contributing to the overall high morale of the team.     Excellent interpersonal and written communications skills. Commitment to excellent customer service.     Ability to interact with internal customers by providing support via phone, web, and email; as well as team-oriented interaction with all.     Requires the ability to work in an area requiring special attention to detail and regular monthly deadlines.     Requires ability to handle highly confidential company and employee expense information with appropriate level of professionalism and sensitivity.

column1: Head Legal  & Compliance  - SE Forge Limited
column2: Role & responsibilities As the Lead Legal and compliance with expertise in litigation, contracts, labor, and compliance, you will play a critical role in providing legal support and guidance to the organization across various areas of law. You will be responsible for managing legal matters related to litigation, contract negotiation and management, labor and employment issues, and regulatory compliance. This role requires a dynamic individual with strong analytical skills, a comprehensive understanding of legal principles, and the ability to effectively navigate complex legal challenges in a fast-paced environment. You will also play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth operation of the company's administrative and governance functions. This position requires a blend of strategic oversight, regulatory compliance, and operational management skills. You will be responsible for managing corporate governance, compliance, legal affairs, and providing support to the board of directors and senior management team. 1. Litigation Management:- Manage and oversee all aspects of litigation matters, including disputes, claims, and legal proceedings.- Work closely with external legal counsel to develop case strategies, prepare pleadings, and represent the company in court hearings and arbitration proceedings.- Conduct legal research, analysis, and case evaluations to assess potential risks and liabilities associated with litigation matters.- Collaborate with internal stakeholders to gather relevant information, evidence, and documentation to support legal defense strategies.2. Contracts Management:- Draft, review, and negotiate a variety of commercial contracts, including vendor agreements, service contracts, licensing agreements, and confidentiality agreements.- Ensure that contracts comply with legal requirements, company policies, and industry standards.- Manage contract administration processes, including contract templates, renewal notifications, and tracking key contractual obligations and milestones.- Provide guidance and training to internal teams on contract management best practices and legal compliance requirements.3. Labor and Employment:- Advise on a wide range of labor and employment matters, including employee relations, disciplinary actions, terminations, and workplace investigations.- Stay updated on relevant employment laws and regulations to ensure compliance with labor standards, wage and hour laws, and anti-discrimination statutes.- Develop and implement policies, procedures, and training programs to promote a fair and inclusive work environment and minimize legal risks.- Assist in the resolution of labor disputes, grievances, and employment-related claims through mediation, negotiation, or litigation.4. Compliance:- Develop and Maintain statutory compliance and SEBI compliance programs to ensure adherence to applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards.- Conduct compliance assessments, audits, and risk assessments to identify areas of non-compliance and implement corrective actions.- Provide guidance and training to employees on compliance policies, procedures, and ethical standards.- Serve as a liaison with regulatory agencies and external auditors during compliance reviews and investigations.5. Corporate Governance:- Develop, implement, and maintain corporate governance policies and procedures.- Ensure compliance with statutory and regulatory requirements, including company law, corporate governance codes, and other relevant regulations.- Organize and facilitate board meetings, committee meetings, and general meetings.- Draft and maintain corporate governance documentation such as board minutes, resolutions, and filings.6. Board Support and Communication:- Serve as the primary point of contact between the board of directors and senior management.- Prepare board packs, agendas, and briefing materials for board meetings.- Coordinate communications between the board, management, and shareholders.- Facilitate the flow of information to ensure that the board receives timely and accurate information.7. Corporate Secretarial Duties:- Maintain statutory registers and corporate records in compliance with legal requirements.- File statutory returns and other regulatory documents with relevant authorities.- Manage the process of appointing and retiring directors and officers.- Ensure compliance with corporate governance best practices.- Participate in strategic decision-making processes and provide input on corporate governance and compliance matters.- Collaborate with senior management to develop and implement strategic initiatives.- Drive continuous improvement in corporate governance practices and processes  Key Interactions/ Stakeholders (Internal) Manufacturing operations, Supply ChainQuality assuranceCompliance TeamKey Interactions/ Stakeholders (External) Regulatory Agencies, Vendors,Legal counselPreferred candidate profile  1. Bachelor's degree in Law (LLB) from an accredited institution and Company Secretary (CS); additional certification or specialization in relevant legal areas is a plus.2. Experience with Listed companies in past is must3. Admission to the bar in the jurisdiction where the company operates; active license to practice law.4. Minimum of [5-10] years of experience practicing law, with a focus on litigation, contracts, labor, and compliance, preferably in a corporate or legal firm setting.5. Strong knowledge of legal principles and regulations related to litigation, contract law, labor and employment, and regulatory compliance.6. Proven experience in managing litigation matters, including case management, legal research, and courtroom advocacy.7. Excellent drafting and negotiation skills, with the ability to review and negotiate complex contracts effectively.8. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to assess legal risks and develop practical solutions.9. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with internal stakeholders, external parties, and legal counsel.10. Detail-oriented with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and deadlines in a fast-paced environment.11. Sound judgment, integrity, and ethical conduct in handling confidential information and legal matters.Perks and benefits
column11: LLB in Law, CS in CS
column13: Compliance, company Secretary, Legal, Litigation, Listed companies, Labour, Contracts

column2: Data Operations role at   Consilio   requires deep understanding of file structures and forensic images to ingest electronic data into our proprietary processing platform   The role also requires basic data system-based troubleshooting   This job profile also demands knowledge of the E-discovery project lifecycle with a focus on supporting document review    Responsibilities        Ensure Operations activity progresses as scheduled and required for the eDiscovery projects.     Prioritize tasks for assigned projects and participate in transfer of work from one shift to another shift.     Support managers by providing project status and issue reporting as required.     Provide regular project status and issues updates to Operations management team (Global).     Delegate tasks across Operations shifts as required to maintain consistent level of service.     Perform duties of a shift lead from time to time including proactive queue management, quality control resource management.     Modify and execute complex SQL queries and data file management task.     Track and record project workflow and milestones as required.     Use various ESI discovery data processing platforms to extract text and metadata from electronic documents.     Use multiple products techniques to handle issues with electronic documents tiffing/imaging processes.     Troubleshoot issues that may occur during data loading into hosting platform for review.     Support Project Management by assisting with document searching and tagging in hosted database.     Prepare client data deliverables (including exception reports, delivery reports, execute custom tasks etc.)     Determine the most effective and efficient way to complete tasks and meet client expectations with available resources.     Trouble-shoot and resolve issues prior to escalation to Operations management and/or engineering.     Perform quality control of work product including production QCs, metadata population checks etc.     Provide formal classroom-based training to other team members on E-discovery applications and concepts.     Participate in regular policy and procedure review meetings with other team members.     Assist Operations management with various administrative tasks (e.g., scheduling).     Coordinate with other E-discovery teams (Collections, Forensics, Application Support, Quality Control, Engineering, and PMs) to appropriately plan engagements to meet client deliverables/timelines, resolve specific issues, and improve overall quality and efficiency.     Assist Operations management with planning and documentation of Operations policy and processes.     Conduct and participate in knowledge sharing sessions organized by Operations team from time to time.     Get certified with industry leading certificates like RCA, Nuix Master, six sigma etc.     Manage the day-to-day operations (Data Loading to Productions) of the data operations function for Relativity.       Qualifications        Four-year college degree preferred, preferably in a technical discipline (e.g., Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, etc.)     4-7 years of related E-Discovery or strong database/scripting experience.     Hands-On experience with Nuix and Relativity.     Experience working under tight deadlines in fast-paced data production environment.     Excellent verbal and written communication skills.     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Strong working knowledge of basic PC functions and Windows environment (e.g., MS Office).     Knowledge of general database, networking, and file-systems concepts.     Experience with several of the following preferred: SQL, Visual Basic/VB Script, MS-Access, Advanced text editors and MS-Office.     Ability to perform troubleshooting and learn customized proprietary software.     Intermediate to advanced knowledge of several ESI data processing platforms (e.g., Nuix, Venio, ECapture, Attenex Workbench, LAW, TRUE, Autonomy, Clearwell, Stratify, etc.)     E-discovery products certifications are an added advantage.     Intermediate to advanced knowledge of several ESI data hosting platforms (e.g., Concordance, Relativity, Introspect, Ominx, Catalyst, Attenex DocMapper, etc.)     Ability to read and interpret quality rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
